page.title: 07HIGHER KEHELLAND FARM
page.content: Higher Kehelland Farm and Kieve Mill Farm are two of the farms owned and worked by the Bennet family.The entire holding consists of about 240 acres. There is a small beef herd of Friesian and Hereford cross cattle which were inside at the time of our visit. They were due to be moved outside once the sileage had been cut.This is done to avoid the cattle trampling the grass before it is cropped which could cost a 20% loss of grass. The large farm machinery was kept at Kieve Mill and included a Combine Harvester,a potato picker,ploughs, a fertiliser spreader and seed drills. A number of the fields were used for growing grass and at this time of year (June-July) sileage is cut,baled and bagged,using a round baler,a machine which collected,bundled and tied the cut grass.
